text: _@popstar48 has joined the channel_
_@ellie.ansell has joined the channel_

Poppy, please meet Ellie your incredible E-Mentor which I mentioned to you! Feel free to introduce yourselves and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now and happy chatting! :smile:
_@dexter has left the channel_
_@dexter has left the channel_
Hey Ellie, it’s nice to meet you
Hi poppy! Nice to meet you! I've been told you're into drawing?
Yes that’s right, I’m a 2D Animation student at staffs uni in my 3rd year

Nice :slightly_smiling_face: So what is your goal career-wise? I work in Framestore, a 3D VFX studio in London. There are different departments in the company, such as design (which you may be more interested in?), labs (programming), film, advertising. There are the usual 3D departments such as rigging, modelling..etc. in film/ advertising.

If there's any work you'd like help with critique on, just throw it my way. It would help if you told me a little bit more about yourself, such as favourite uni assignment, your strength/ weak areas etc.

I’d say my favourite uni assignment is the Final major project which I’m currently working on at the moment, which is all 2D digitally hand drawn and animated in toonboom/harmony and photoshop. I like to try different things but my real passion is drawing. I think my weakness is 3D work such as rigging & VFX related things honestly. My goal career wise would be storyboarding, but I also like do work on concept art and character animation.

Ah nice ^_^ We have similar interests which is handy. My passion is drawing too, and when I was younger I did 2D animations. But I graduated and moved into a job as a developer doing programming as I was desperate to get a job quickly. Consequentially, I keep being put on technical projects - meanwhile I'll draw sketches on my desk. From this anecdote, I'd say do what you love - don't rush into a job you're not keen on for the sake of job security (it did work however..)

yeah that’s true :blush: sometimes I think it’s alittle intimidating getting into the industry like that though honestly, like I worry that there may not be a job that I’d be keen on doing or I’d end up in a job where I have no idea what I’m doing :sweat_smile:
Yeah exactly - it's so scary, and making the wrong move can get you in a rutt that's hard to get out of o.o

Just whatever you do.... don't be a runner... unless you know for certain the runners move up quickly! There are people at companies who have been cleaning pots for months even though they have degrees and are super talented. It so wrong.
*It's
Ah I’ve been told by lecturers that a job as a runner is a good thing? So that’s only the case if you know they move up quickly..Is it really that bad to do?? :face_with_hand_over_mouth:

I think that if you've graduated with a first class (or high 2:1) degree after paying 9k a year, being a runner in London for 16k or so is a kick in the teeth- I reckon you're better off relaxing at home (if you can), adding more things to your showreel etc, then reapplying for jobs later. Or if you are a runner, just make sure you don't do it for more than 3 months-6 months, and make sure that you can get help from professionals at the same time and use the workstations, and get a chance to work on secondment.
It does vary from company to company how they treat runners though
Also I don't seem to get notifs so sorry if my replys are really delayed haha

Haha yeah it’s okay I don’t think the notifications are working on here for some reason, I’ve tried myself but it doesn’t seem to work so sorry if mine are delayed too :sweat_smile:
& Ah that makes sense! How did you go about getting a job yourself? Did you find one straight away or did you have to do something different first??

I had a graduation show at my uni, and I met someone who worked in industry there. He got me into the industry - I started as an interactive developer in framestore labs. After 8 months of wayyy too much code and not enough art, I transferred to commercials.
Which was still lots of code haha - but I'm doing more arty things now xD I do rnd, some groom (that was the best!!), and I'm currently rigging a mantaray for some rnd crowd!
do you have a gradshow?
I imagine you do, but if not, you should urge lecturers to do one. And make sure you go to events such as Access:VFX, BFX and industry fairs etc :slightly_smiling_face:

Ah yeah we do have one, but us current third years haven’t done ours yet :) I have nana to the recent access VFX event in Salford, Manchester and found it interesting but I don’t think vfx is really my focus. I also went to Manchester Animation festival a couple years ago but it’s mainly been conventions I’ve been attending lately like the London MXM expos :slightly_smiling_face:
Mmm ok! Are you into animes in that case?
I've got a friend who's in cartoon network as an environment artist which sounds cool. He did the same course as me, but went on to that. :stuck_out_tongue:

Wow I would love to do that! He’s so lucky, How did he get spotted? I used to be into anime but I’m not now much as I used to. I’m really into cartoons and animated films nowadays and watching the new stuff that’s been bought out really inspires me. Honestly my dream job would be to work for Cartoon Network and to work on kids tv shows :smile:

Ohhh good to know! ^_^ I think he just applied and got the job. He showed he had good life-drawing skills in his work - they really look out for having a 'good-eye'. If it's in colour, sketches... there are facebook groups like daily spitpaint you might have heard of which encourage quick painting/drawing. ten-thousand-hours is good too, and level-up. (These are all fb groups btw)

Ahh that’s good to know too! I’ll have to do more life drawing, they have sessions in uni once a week I think but I like to draw general life out in cafe’s and stuff :blush: I’ll definitely check out those fb groups too! That’s really useful thank you :smile: I was wondering if there are any specific software or Apps in particular you would recommend using for drawing too at all?
(Just a heads up my battery about to die so if I don’t reply that’s why :sweat_smile:)
